Opinion: "El sitio es obligatorio pues ves a Guanajuato en su vista panorámica. Se recomienda ir de noche pues se siente como si estuvieras en otro mundo. Lugar para tomar fotos de la ciudad o con tus acompañantes, reflexionar, tomar decisiones, enamorar a tu pareja, etc, etc. Lo que más me gustó fue los sentimientos que me hizo sentir. Debes llevar cámara fotográfica, zapatos cómodos, ropa ligera, lentes oscuros y crema para el sol (si es de día), cafe y abrigo si es de noche. Es de visita larga puedes estar todo el tiempo que quieras, claro en la noche te puede quedar mas rato que en el día por el sol."

Title: "El Pípila"
Opinion: "Lo han renovado y está mucho mejor, una excelente vista a la ciudad de Guanajuato desde arriba."

Title: "El Pípila"
Opinion: "La historia de México representada en los monumentos es algo que, en lo personal, me llena de emocion."

Title: "¡Mirador!"
Opinion: "En el monumento al Pípila hay un mirador de toda la ciudad que es increíble."

Title: "SKIP IT, JUST LOOK AT IT FROM AFAR"
Opinion: "Dubious story for starters. It is mostly a place for vendors hawking food."

Title: "Mirador de Guanajuato"
Opinion: "Único lugar que puede dominar gran parte de la ciudad y que permite soñar que vemos un nacimiento frente a nosotros."

Title: "El mirador de Guanajuato"
Opinion: "Puedes subir por el teleférico ubicado atras del Teatro Juárez, caminando o en carro. Desde ahí puedes ver casi todo Guanajuato, recuerda llevar tu camára pues la vista es espectacular. Lo malo es que hay muchos vendedores ambulantes, no está muy limpio, siempre hay muchísima gente y tendrás que tomar tu turno para tomar rápidamente tus fotos."

Title: "HUGE statue the size of David in Florence Italy"
Opinion: "Great legend of indigenous miner. We found Martin, a local artist, displaying his sketches who gave us an explanation of the statue and hx of the city."

Title: "What a view of the city!"
Opinion: "From the city you can take the funicular rail up to this area but we drove here as we were leaving the area and wow, the view is worth the trip! You could see the whole city and there is also a statue you can climb with a small glass box at the top for an even higher viewpoint."

Title: "La mejor panorámica"
Opinion: "Si bien, el monumento al Pípila no es algo que te deslumbre, la vista panorámica que se tiene hacia el centro de Guanajuato es increíble. Además, la experiencia del funicular es muy buena, especialmente si viajas con niños."

Title: "Guanajuato a la vista"
Opinion: "Muy bella vista de la ciudad desde este mirador, tanto de día como de noche. Lo unico malo es que cuando cae el sol está zona queda muy solitaria."

Title: "Linda vista"
Opinion: "Fue parte de un tour cuando bajas del autobus se te acerca gente muy amable que te orienta y te ofrece paquetes. Una vista maravillosa como de postal."

Title: "Vista"
Opinion: "La vista es increíble, aprecias todo lo bello que es."

Title: "Excelente vista"
Opinion: "Obra impresionante, la vista que te proporciona de Guanajuato desde este lugar es maravillosa."

Title: "Vista magistral"
Opinion: "No te pierdas... sin pasar por el teatro para tomar el funicular... bienvenidos a la cumbre con bonitas tiendas de artesanía. Luego vista panorámica de la ciudad al pie del monumento. Nos quedaríamos mucho más tiempo. Lo más destacado de la visita y tómese el tiempo para ver todo en esta hermosa ciudad."

Title: "Monumento Pípila"
Opinion: "De forma similar a otros sitios de esta historia ciudad, patrimonio de la humanidad. Tiene una hermosa panorámica durante la noche, aún más si hay fuegos pirotecnicos."

Title: "The best view of Guanajuato!"
Opinion: "The best part of this monument is the view of the city, you can get there by taking a hike from downtonw Guanajuato, taking the funicular or by car. A must if you are in Guanajuato!"

Title: "The Best View of GTO!"
Opinion: "This is where i plan to get married someday overlooking the city at sunset! AWESOME!"

Title: "Bonita vista"
Opinion: "Es un lugar bonito, puedes ver toda la ciudad y hay algunos puestos para comprar recuerdos a buen precio."

Title: "Incredible views of Guanajuato"
Opinion: "Be sure to time it with sun rise or sun set so that the sun illuminates the vibrant colours of the town below! If you go in the middle of the day you don't get this."

Title: "Vista extraordinaria de la ciudad"
Opinion: "Si van a Guanajuato este lugar se debe conocer. Yo recomiendo visitarlo después de haber caminado en el centro de la ciudad ya que una vez que subes aprecias mejor la vista. Hay personas que se acercan para dar una explicación y a mi parecer eso le da un buen toque."

Title: "Muy bueno"
Opinion: "Enorme y con una vista impresionante a toda la ciudad."

Title: "Great views of the city"
Opinion: "Take the funicular from behind Basilica San Diego. Beautiful views of the city. The monument is in a 1930's style. A 'must see' if you have a short time in Guanajuato."

Title: "Hermosa vista panorámica"
Opinion: "Una excelente vista panorámica de la ciudad. Aunque hacen como 5º menos de temperatura en relación a la ciudad."

Title: "Vale por el teleférico y la vista"
Opinion: "El monumento en sí es bastante insulso, sin embargo el teleférico y la vista lo valen, recomiendo contratar a un niño que les explieque la ciudad con un texto aprendido y mus simpático, recomendable bajar a pie entre los callejos, esta muy bien señalado y es seguro y muestra rincones de Guanajuato."

Title: "Whata view!"
Opinion: "Taking lots of photos this trip? Get on the Funicula and go up from the Jardin de Union and fire away. Panoramic view of GTO can't be beat!"

Title: "Postal de Guanajuato"
Opinion: "Es el sitio obligado al visitar Guanajuato pues desde allí se puede contemplar un hermosa postal de la ciudad."

Title: "Excellent view of the city"
Opinion: "You can get there by car or a small train. It is worth it to visit the place in the nights"

Title: "Hermosa vista"
Opinion: "Poquito espacio arriba en el mirador, escaleras muy angostas, pero la vista es maravillosa. Recomiendo subir al funicular."

Title: "Best View"
Opinion: "Best view in town, take the funicular to the top, dodge the sounenier vendors and take it in."

Title: "Lindo panorama"
Opinion: "Se ve todo la vista de la ciutad. Es muy lindo de día y de noche."

Title: "Great view of the city"
Opinion: "The monument itself is nothing that exciting but there's an excellent view of the town from it. take the funicular up but walk down, it's easy to find and navigate"

Title: "Great view"
Opinion: "Good place to see the whole city dont bother with the museum by the lift."

Title: "Worth the hike for the amazing view!"
Opinion: "The best view of the City is from this monument. It'll cost you 6 pesos (50 cents) to go up and its pretty much the exact same view from below. Its more fun though if you take the Funicular for 30 pesos (round trip). More shops up there too. If you go at night, bring a jacket because its very windy and cold! A Must-see as a part of Guanajuato's history."

Title: "Monumento muy bonito pero mal cuidado"
Opinion: "Este imponente monumento a un personaje tan importante en el estado esta en malas condiciones, hay mucho ambulantaje, el área está sucia, el tráfico es desquiciante, pero sobre todo los vendedores más que insistentes, esto debería ser más cuidado por las autoridades."

Title: "Terrific view and photo-op. OK to skip the climb inside the statue."
Opinion:
"Other reviewers have said it all with regard to the important and inspiring history of this monument, so I will stick to the practical aspects. Our kids loved the "funicular" tram ride from behind Teatro Juarez up to the top (costs a few dollars which includes entrance to the museum, or you can walk up the many stairs for free), and there is a small museum and gift shops (including a very nice leather goods store where the owners hand-make purses, belts and wallets on site) between the tram and the monument, and more gift shops across the road from the statue itself.

The view from Pipila is amazing, and the plaza is ideally configured to allow a great photo of you with the panoramic view of the colorful city as the backdrop. We paid 50 cents and waited in line ten minutes to climb inside the statue, but immediately regretted it. There is only room for about 5-6 people to stand comfortably at the top. Visitors self-regulate access to the stairs, and we ended up crammed in the little glass-enclosed turret as part of a group of 9 people. The kids didn't mind, but for me it triggered a bit of claustrophobia and we left (with some difficulty) as quick as we could. Honestly, the view from the plaza is better than from inside the statue anyway.

Overall, a don't-miss stop on any tour of Guanajuato. Don't forget your camera!"

Title: "Amazing view over a beautiful city"
Opinion: "Pipila at sunset is one of the highlights of any trip to Guanajuato. Looking down over the city and retracing a day's exploration is a blast. The churches, parks, and university are all spread before you. Another highlight is the constant stream of people coming and photographing each other. It's quite amusing to see their enthusiastic poses!"

Title: "There will always be other Alhondigas to burn"
Opinion:
"In 1810, the people of Mexico rose up against their Spanish opressors and thus began the Mexican revolution. Led by the charismatic Father Miguel Hidalgo, the revolutionaries invaded the city of Guanajuato, only to find that the Spanish had all sought refuge in the Alhondiga Granaditas, the town's grainery.

Made of impenetrable stone, the Alhondiga was a virtual fortress offering the Spanish protection and an offensive position to shoot at anyone approaching them.

It looked like the revolutionaries were out of luck, until a local miner nicknamed
''El Pipila,'' stepped up to the challenge. Strapping a large stone to his back, Pipila avoided the shots from the Spanish as he approached the wooden door to the fortress. He then burnt down the door, allowing the Mexicans to come inside seeking justice for all the wrongs done to their people over the centuries.

El Pipila was the first real Mexican hero of the revolution. Immortalized in local stone, His monument now holds a place of honor overlooking the city from the panoramica. Easy to get to by bus, funicular (tram) or walking, the Pipila monument gives you the best view of the whole city. A colorful view during the day, the lights in the evening are beautiful as well. This is a can't miss attraction."

Title: "Aún hay otras alhóndigas por incendiar"
Opinion:
"El Pípila era un joven minero llamado Juan José de los Reyes Martínez Amaro; sus compañeros lo habían apodado así porque su risa era como la de un pavo o guajolote (pípila significa pavo)

Este valiente joven tuvo un papel crucial en la guerra de Independencia, se unió a las huestes de Miguel Hidalgo a su paso por San Miguel de Allende en septiembre de 1810 y combatió en la Alhóndiga de Granaditas, un almacén de semillas donde se guarecieron los españoles ante la amenaza de la Rebelión.

Tras un arduo combate la Alhóndiga permaneción impenetrable. El Pípila se puso una pesada losa en la espalda para protegerse de los disparos y arriesgando su vida se acercó a la Alhóndiga con una antorcha encendida, de las que utilizan los mineros en la mina, e incendió la puerta, permitiendo el paso de los insurgentes y ganando la batalla.

La visita al Monumento del Pípila incluye la más impresionante vistas panorámica de la ciudad de Guanajuato y varios puestos de artesanías."

Title: "Pipila is to the village of Guanajuato, what the Statue of Liberty is to the city of New York"
Opinion:
The Pipila Monument/Plaza weighs approximately 800 M/tons and is almost 25mt/80ft tall. It is made of pink cantera stone from the hills of Guanajuato. Being made of stone, this Pipila has the Ben Grimm look, "thing" of the Fantastic Four. (the guy with strength and endurance "Because of his stone-like flesh) The monument sits just 90 meters above the Jardin de Union. The Jardin being the dead center of the village.

The Pipila Monument/Plaza is on Cerro San Miguel where it meets the Panoramica, the road that goes around the top of Guanajuato. You can drive to Pipila, take a bus, a cab, the Funicular or walk to the monument. By foot, about 550 steps up from the center of town!! You can take the "Pipila - ISSSET" bus for 5 pesos, a cab for 25 pesos and parking next to the monument runs 15 pesos per hour. Or you can take the Rail tram (Funicular) from the center of town and the tram will drop you off between Casa Zuniga and the Pipila Monument Plaza. At the time of this writing, a one-way tram ticket runs 15 pesos.

It's said, "...Pipila is holding a torch that stand for liberty. His hand held high is claiming victory. And he is standing over three steps, each step represents 100 years of Spanish Rule...". Pipila is facing San Miguel de Allende, the home of Juan Jose,de los Reyes Martinez (Pipila).

Because Pipila worked in the Rayas mine, the first mine in Guanajuato, Pipila knew about a mining supply store on Galarza street. The store was not too far from the Alhondiga de Granaditas. The Alhondiga at the time was a huge public grain store house where the Spanish solders had taken refuge, anticipating a siege. The insurgents broke into the mining store and took what was needed to burn down the Alhondiga's wooden door. Pipila using a mecapal to carry slab of limestone sidewalk on his back. This slab was his shield from rocks. With his limestone shield and the help of 20,000 insurgents throwing rocks at the Spanish in the Alhondiga, Pipila was able to reach the main door where he broke the clay jug of "la brea" on it and set his torch to it. The door burns down and the insurgents enter the Alhondiga and win the first battle for independence.

Is Pipila the best attraction in Guanajuato? View-wise, nothing comes close!! This part of Cerro de San Miguel is at a curve and sticks out to give more of a view. Plus it's just meters from the dead center of town. Ask one of the monument/plaza guides to give you an over-view from the plaza vantage point. The cost is nothing. They work for tips.

Here's something that could be of use, use the Pipila monument as a reference point that can help you get your bareing on the windy streets below.

From the plaza you ca see, Templo San Cayetano of the Valenciana Mine, Rayas Mine, a dozen churchs, the Alhondiga de Granaditas, The Diego Rivera home, Teatro Jaurez, the Gustave Eiffel French train station (mercado Hidelgo), the University of Guanajuato and a ton more!!!"

Title: "Well worth the climb up walking or else take the cable car"
Opinion: "El Pípila is the miner who courageously managed to burn down the door of the Alhóndiga fortress in the first battle of the Mexican movement for independence when Hidalgo and his 20,000 army arrived in Guanajuato to find the Spanish troops holed up in the heavily fortified Alhóndiga. This location offers fabulous views across the city and is well worth the climb if you are in Guanajuato. Also at the top, there is great street food."

Title: "Maravilloso paisaje"
Opinion: "Quería ver el paisaje del día o del anochecer, subir la segunda colina. No sé por qué la casa de Guanajuato es rosa, amarilla o azul claro, pero puedes pasar por alto la colorida y linda ciudad de todos modos. La plataforma del teleférico está detrás del Teatro Juárez y la pantalla es difícil de entender, pero hay una taquilla frente a la carretera en un edificio de concreto."

Title: "Wonderful views of Guanajuato from Pipila"
Opinion: "I guess there is a bus that can take you up to the site and you can also walk up but your heart will be beating between the steep hill and the altitude. We took the funicular up and walked down. It was 15 pesos for the ride up. We talked with another visitor who took the funicular up with us and he bought a combo ticket for the ride up and the museum at the top but he said the museum was not worth it. The views from the site were spectacular and we took a bunch of photos of prominent sites in town from above. Our hotel was across on the opposite hillside so we had a good look at town from both sides. Pipila was a hero from the start of the war of Mexican independence back around 1810 and he has been honored with a large statue. His nickname is Pipila so the site is called by the same name. It's worth your time. The walk down took us past lots of hillside homes."

Title: "¡Con vistas a la ciudad colonial más hermosa de México!"
Opinion: "Guanajuato se encuentra a aproximadamente 5 horas en autobús desde la ciudad de México. Es más popular entre los japoneses. Es la colina del Pípila con la estatua del Pípila que puede ver tal ciudad de Guanajuato. El acceso a la colina de Pípila es conveniente para Funicular (teleférico) desde la parte posterior del Teatro Juárez frente al Parque La Unión. Llegará a la cima de la colina en aproximadamente un minuto (N $ 15 por trayecto). Aunque puedo subir incluso si camino, necesito caminar por un camino estrechamente curvado durante unos 10 a 15 minutos (me llevaba bien cuando bajaba, pero la seguridad no se veía bien). El paisaje se recomienda desde la noche por la noche. Era muy hermoso que las luces de las casas en las laderas de las montañas estuvieran encendidas. Es una lástima que no lo veo bien en la foto... Desde la ciudad de México hasta Guanajuato, utilizaré el autobús Primera Plus, que está a aproximadamente 1 hora de la Terminal Norte de la Ciudad de México. En la guía, el autobús a Guanajuato fue escrito como N $ 245 ~ 371 (1 N $ ? 7.5 yenes en agosto de 2009), pero fue de N $ 314 en Primera Plus. Mañana 6:00 Fue difícil levantarse un poco en el autobús de salida, así que tomé un autobús en Primera Plus a las 7:30 de la mañana. La tarifa del autobús incluía bebidas y aperitivos. Desde la terminal de autobuses en Guanajuato hay un autobús (N $ 4) hasta Centro (centro de la ciudad). Es mejor sentarse en el lado derecho de la dirección de viaje y verificar el nombre de la parada de autobús, ya que el autobús con destino a la ciudad pasa por el pasadizo subterráneo utilizando el antiguo canal subterráneo y el túnel y no puede salir del escenario."

Title: "A great place to sit and relax."
Opinion: "This is a nice place to enjoy a beautiful view and people watch. If you take a guided bus tour around town it will take you here by road to the top. But even if you do that, I think it's still worthwhile to ride the funicular. The ticket booth is just a minute's walk from the Jardin Union. Round trip tickets run about $2.00 each. Great view during the ride and fun:)"
